name: Reina-Chan
description:
Reina-Chan is a free fangame based on the Girls' Frontline franchise, featuring gameplay identical to Mega Man. And stolen sprites.

Reina-Chan's first demo is here! Play through Architect's stage, unlock her weapon, then play through it again!

Plot

The year is 21XX. In some alternate universe, Griffin exists, 404 Team stopped being "404" and ended up living there, AR Team got back together, and Dandelai became the second most competent person in the base next to the commander.

Dier is visiting Griffin to work on a new highly advanced battle simulator with the help of Dandelai. UMP9 volunteers herself to be the first to try it out. Play as UMP9 and defeat all eight Sangvis Ferri, then make your way to SF HQ and take out Elisa!
* Only Architect's stage is available for the first demo.

Features
  • Classic 8-bit platformer action!
  • True NES audio played back from NSF files!
  • Or "CD Audio" by supplying your own mp3, ogg, or wav files in the CustomMusic folder.
  • 75% free and open source software!
  • Custom level AND custom cutscene support! Create your own levels or cutscenes and share them with your friends.
  • Available for Windows and Linux.
  • I compressed the data a lot so it would fit under 100MB.
Legal stuff

Girls' Frontline is property of MICA, this is a free fangame, no copyright infringement intended.

Mega Man is property of Capcom.

You are free to modify and redistribute the sprite artwork in this game, but please don't charge or make money off of it in any way. Girls' Frontline is property of MICA, you shouldn't be charging for it in the first place.

The engine's source code (minus the cutscene interpreter) is GPLv3. The cutscene interpreter is CC-BY-NC-SA.

We're looking for help!

We currently need more stage designers, beta testers, programmers, idea guys, writers, and pretty much anything you can think of that would help.

Please check https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ewSVlGVnjd23sST4sBqYafCf7XzqA6tKRA5D9vw2jLk for information on joining the development team.
